results.title: Hockey-the Skills Revolution
results.brief_description: This program demonstrates the latest techniques and skills using the Australian National Team players and their coach, Richard Aggiss. Receiving skills, possession skills, elimination skills, passing skills, goal scoring, penalty strokes, tackles and goal keeping are all demonstrated by world champions Charlesworth, Walsh, Bell, Hazelhurst, Snowden and Berce. Endorsed by the Australian Hockey Association.

results.creator_credit: F.E. Brooker and Emerson Yorke Studio
results.brief_description: How to select and mount the hob; how to set the swivel head angel; how to choose and mount the fixture; how to lead the gear blanks; how to set up for depth trial cut; and how to adjust full depth of cut.

results.title: Hobbing a spur gear. Part I. Setting of the change gears
results.creator_credit: F.E. Brooker and Emerson Yorke Studio
results.brief_description: Shows the factors governing the selection of the hob; how to select change-gear combinations for speed, feed, and index; how to identify the correct gears; how to mount the change gears; how to adjust for backlash; and how the change-gear strains are interrelated.

results.title: Hobart: island capital
results.brief_description: The tourist attractions of Hobart, the peaceful capital in the Derwent Valley under the shadow of Mt Wellington. Although many attractive new buildings are rising in the business centre of the city, the old buildings with their historical associations retain the greatest charm. The sea and the docks are only a few minutes from the city and the Royal Hobart Regatta is a highlight of the Tasmanian year.

results.title: Hobart town
results.creator_credit: Hugh McInnes, Maslyn Williams, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: A description of Hobart, Tasmania and its surrounding districts, which are crowded with historic buildings and monuments dating back to the first settlers and convicts.

results.title: HMAS Stalwart
results.brief_description: The destroyer tender HMAS Stalwart is the largest naval vessel yet built in Australia. Designed to provide maintenance facilities, the ship has a well equipped workshop for repairs usually done ashore.

results.title: Hitler: the road to revenge
results.creator_credit: Don Thompson, New York Times Productions and Nielsen-Ferns
results.brief_description: Shows how Hitler’s personality, and the social, political and economic conditions in the 1930’s, played a large role in his rise to power. Also indicates the means by which he achieved power: mass psychology, propaganda and physical violence. Narrated by Henry Fonda. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Hitler: the final chapter
results.creator_credit: Cyril Jones and Cyril Jones and Associates
results.brief_description: One of the most discussed questions in history, “what really happened to Hitler?” is the subject of this investigative documentary, written and produced by Cyril Jones. He uses footage obtained from the Russian Film Archives to support his case as well as the testimony of Elena Rjeveskaia, last surviving member of the SMERSH team. The documentary also covers the fate of Hitler’s chosen successor, Dr Joseph Goebbels, and his family.
